column3: You should perhaps also add this for bitcoin-qt.pro I guess.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/f1560d9fe0e00f875353237f6d0224acc3bab07a for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in contrib/tes
Please paste the compiler error into the commit.  The details about what this solves remain vague.\n
@TheBlueMatt do these error messages mean that -DBOOST_CHRONO_HEADER_ONLY doesn't work on Windows? We can just disable it there, as we link with boost_chrono on Windows anyway.\n
Hmm... "error: WinError.h: No such file or directory" maybe a mingw issue?\n
In any case, it did try to use ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED, so I suppose it may be trying to call some error handler...\n

Bah.

Linking against the boost chrono library on all platforms is another option; we should be consistent.

FYI: error is:

Undefined symbols:
  "boost::chrono::steady_clock::now()", referenced from:
      boost::cv_status boost::condition_variable::wait_for<long long, boost::ratio<1ll, 1000000000ll> >(boost::unique_lockboost::mutex&, boost::chrono::duration<long long, boost::ratio<1ll, 1

Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/fdcc3f1aee11701668d841cadd54c63be9526d73 for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in contrib/tes

frickin frackin....

Ok, so -DBOOST_CHRONO_HEADERONLY breaks the Windows build.
Linking against boost_chrono breaks the Linux build.

I suppose we'll have to live with being inconsistent, and link boost_chrono on Windows/OSX but not Linux.
